result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alysha M. Kirkland

records.addlTxt:
1:07 PM Defendant Alysha M. Kirkland appeared by video from the Portage County Jail.  Attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Maxwell Bergner appears on behalf of the defendant.

Ms. Kirkland is eligible for public defender representation. 

Court reviews the file. 
Court questions Atty Bergner regarding Ms. Kirkland's previous non-appearance. 

$500 cash bond is requested by the State for reasons stated on record. 
Atty Bergner asks that the signature bond be reinstated for reasons stated on record. 

BY THE COURT: Warrant is quashed.
Signature bond is reinstated. 
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on December 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:08 PM Defendant Alysha M. Kirkland not in court.  Attorney Brian Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 

State requests warrant for Defendant failing to appear for Court. 
Court questions the State for proper service. 
State informs the Court there was proper service. 
Court reviews the criminal complaint for probable cause. 
Court finds there is probable cause and grants the request for warrant.
ADA Pfeil would request a warrant.
Court questions if the defendant is still in custody.
ADA Pfeil looks to see if the defendant is in custody.
Defendant signed a signature bond on 10/04/22.
Defendant is no longer in custody.
State would ask for a cash alternative in the amount of $500

BY THE COURT:
*  Warrant with $500 cash alternative
Adjourned Initial Appearance set for 10/24/22 - VACANT

ADDRESS INFO for Alysha M. Kirkland
Current: 620 9th Street South, Wisconsin Rapids, WI 54494 United States  (Effective: 09-09-2022)
Prior: 6309 Oak Lane Ct # 12, Stevens Point, WI 54482

11/4/2022 Signature Bond Reinstated. /s/MDZ

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Participate in the Portage County Justice Programs and comply with the requirements for assessment and reporting, if she lives in Portage County.

3:03 PM Defendant Alysha M. Kirkland appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant states she did not get a criminal complaint.
Defendant to contact the public defender to get an attorney.
Matter is rescheduled.
Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

BY THE COURT:  Bond is set
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 24, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Initial Appearance set for 10/03/22 @ 2:15 p.m. in Br 3
